pageContext.description: Fractured cutting end of celt. Hollow to 1 1/16" (27mm) from cutting edge. Examination shows it has been used as a wedge at an early period after fracture from main body.
pageContext.surface: Good condition, very little corrosion. Signs of original fracture mostly obliterated by hammering which has flattened surfaces.
pageContext.associations: Celt found within 476 Yds. 1943, & gouge within 306 Yards in 1954.
pageContext.site: England,Hertfordshire,Thorley,100 Yards of North of Thorley Church, 1961
pageContext.toSearch: Thorley, Bishop's Stortford, Hertfordshire Cm23, UK
pageContext.remarks: There is a L.B.A. & R.B. site between NG 486194 & NG 486198, & spearhead found at NG 502208
